usb_dfuspec.h

00001 /*
00002 ** FILE NAME:    usb_dfuspec.h
00003 **
00004 ** PROJECT:              Meta/DSP Software Library
00005 **
00006 ** TITLE:                USB Device Firmware Upgrade Class.
00007 **
00008 ** AUTHOR:               Ensigma Technologies, a division of Imagination Technologies
00009 **
00010 ** DESCRIPTION:  Specification definitions.
00011 **
00012 ** MODIFICATION
00013 ** HISTORY:               1.0
00014 */
00015 #ifndef USB_DFUSPEC_H
00016 #define USB_DFUSPEC_H
00017 
00018 #if defined (WIN32)
00019 #define __ATTR_PACKED__
00020 #else
00021 #define __ATTR_PACKED__         __attribute__ ((packed))
00022 #endif
00023 
00024 /* DFU class codes */
00025 #define DFU_CLASS_CODE    0xfe
00026 #define DFU_SUBCLASS_CODE 0x01
00027 
00028 /* DFU functional descriptor values */
00029 #define DFU_LENGTH          0x07
00030 #define DFU_DESCRIPTOR_TYPE 0x21
00031 
00032 /* DFU functional descriptor */
00033 typedef struct usb_dfu_functional_descriptor_t
00034 {
00035     unsigned char bLength;
00036     unsigned char bDescriptorType;
00037     unsigned char bmAttributes;
00038     unsigned char wDetatchTimeOut[2];
00039     unsigned char wTransferSize[2];
00040 }__ATTR_PACKED__ DFU_FUNCTIONAL_DESCRIPTOR;
00041 
00042 #define DFU_FUNCTIONAL_DESCRIPTOR_LENGTH        DFU_LENGTH
00043 
00044 /* DFU request codes.
00045  * Note: These have been extended to include the non-DFU spec request
00046  * DFU_DISCONNECT.
00047  */
00048 enum DFU_REQUEST_CODES {
00049     DFU_DETATCH = 0,
00050     DFU_DNLOAD,
00051     DFU_UPLOAD,
00052     DFU_GETSTATUS,
00053     DFU_CLRSTATUS,
00054     DFU_GETSTATE,
00055     DFU_ABORT,
00056     DFU_DISCONNECT
00057 };
00058 
00059 /* DFU device states */
00060 enum DFU_STATES {
00061     DFU_APP_IDLE = 0,
00062     DFU_APP_DETATCH,
00063     DFU_IDLE,
00064     DFU_DNLOAD_SYNC,
00065     DFU_DNBUSY,
00066     DFU_DNLOAD_IDLE,
00067     DFU_MANIFEST_SYNC,
00068     DFU_MANIFEST,
00069     DFU_MANIFEST_WAIT_RESET,
00070     DFU_UPLOAD_IDLE,
00071     DFU_ERROR,
00072     DFU_NUM_STATES
00073 };
00074 
00075 /* Invalid state definition.
00076  * This is not part of the DFU spec.
00077  */
00078 #define DFU_INVALID_STATE 0xffffffff
00079 
00080 /* DFU status codes */
00081 enum DFU_STATUS_CODES {
00082     DFU_OK = 0,
00083     DFU_ERR_TARGET,
00084     DFU_ERR_FILE,
00085     DFU_ERR_WRITE,
00086     DFU_ERR_ERASE,
00087     DFU_ERR_CHECK_ERASED,
00088     DFU_ERR_PROG,
00089     DFU_ERR_VERIFY,
00090     DFU_ERR_ADDRESS,
00091     DFU_ERR_NOTDONE,
00092     DFU_ERR_FIRMWARE,
00093     DFU_ERR_VENDOR,
00094     DFU_ERR_USBR,
00095     DFU_ERR_POR,
00096     DFU_ERR_UNKNOWN,
00097     DFU_ERR_STALLEDPKT
00098 };
00099 
00100 #define DFU_RESERVED_BITS 0xa
00101 
00102 /* The Attributes field of a DFU Functional Descriptor is a bitmask that
00103  * describes the capabilities of the device. Define bit masks and extraction
00104  * macros.
00105  */
00106 #define DFU_DOWNLOAD_CAPABLE       0x01
00107 #define DFU_UPLOAD_CAPABLE         0x02
00108 #define DFU_MANIFESTATION_TOLERANT 0x04
00109 #define DFU_IS_DOWNLOAD_CAPABLE(Attributes)       (Attributes & DFU_DOWNLOAD_CAPABLE)
00110 #define DFU_IS_UPLOAD_CAPABLE(Attributes)         (Attributes & DFU_UPLOAD_CAPABLE)
00111 #define DFU_IS_MANIFESTATION_TOLERANT(Attributes) ((Attributes) & DFU_MANIFESTATION_TOLERANT)
00112 
00113 /* The DFU specification number we support */
00114 #define DFU_SPEC_NUMBER 0x0100
00115 
00116 /* The magic DFU signature */
00117 #define DFU_SIGNATURE 0x444655
00118 
00119 /* DFU suffix length */
00120 #define DFU_SUFFIX_LENGTH 16
00121 
00122 /* Length to exclude when computing CRC */
00123 #define DFU_CRC_EXCLUDE 4
00124 
00125 /* CRC initialization value */
00126 #define DFU_CRC_INIT 0xffffffff
00127 
00128 /* Macro to extract the PollTimeout member of a DFU_STATUS structure */
00129 #define DFU_GET_POLL_TIMEOUT(Status)  \
00130     ((Status)->PollTimeout[0])      | \
00131     ((Status)->PollTimeout[1] << 8) | \
00132     ((Status)->PollTimeout[2] << 16)
00133 
00134 /* Macro to extract the Signature memeber of a DFU_SUFFIX structure */
00135 #define DFU_GET_SIGNATURE(Suffix)   \
00136     ((Suffix)->Signature[0])      | \
00137     ((Suffix)->Signature[1] << 8) | \
00138     ((Suffix)->Signature[2] << 16)
00139 
00140 /* DFU status structure.
00141  * This is exchanged using a DFU_GETSTATUS request.
00142  */
00143 typedef struct dfu_status_t
00144 {
00145     unsigned char Status;
00146     unsigned char PollTimeout[3];
00147     unsigned char State;
00148     unsigned char String;
00149 } DFU_STATUS_T, DFU_STATUS, *PDFU_STATUS;
00150 
00151 /* DFU suffix structure.
00152  * This structure is appended to the end of a firmware binary file to
00153  * provide id and CRC information.
00154  */
00155 typedef struct dfu_suffix_t
00156 {
00157     unsigned long  Crc;
00158     unsigned char  Length;
00159     unsigned char  Signature[3];
00160     unsigned short Spec;
00161     unsigned short VendorId;
00162     unsigned short ProductId;
00163     unsigned short DeviceRelease;
00164 } DFU_SUFFIX_T, DFU_SUFFIX, *PDFU_SUFFIX;
00165 
00166 #endif /* USB_DFUSPEC_H */
